Name: market for plywood | plywood | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/162:Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials/1621:Manufacture of veneer sheets and wood-based panels
Description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22591/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset represents the global market for plywood. It is not specific to a type of plywood by number and height of the wood layers, but represents a generic product.;Plywood is made out of glued veneers. Veneers are thin sheets of wood obtained by sawing, cutting, or peeling. ;Reference:;Kollmann F. F. P., Kuenzi E. W. and Stamm A. J. (1975) Principles of Wood Science and Technology. Springer-Verl., Berlin, Heidelberg, New York. AND Nimz H., Schmitt U., Schwab E., Wittmann O. and Wolf F. (1997) Wood. In:  Ullmann's encyclopedia of indus-trial chemistry (ed. Anonymous). 5th edition on CD-ROM Edition. Wiley & Sons, London.;Rüter, S. and S. Diederichs (2012): Ökobilanz-Basisdaten für Bauprodukte aus Holz. Arbeitsbericht aus dem Institut für Holztechnologie und Holzbiologie Nr. 2012/1, Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut (vTI), Hamburg. 

Activity starts with the product leaving the factory gate, ready for shipment

Activity ends with the reception of the product at the consuming entity. Average transportation requirements from producer (to central distribution point and) to consuming entity are covered.
